title: Azadeh Baniasad
text:
Azadeh Baniasad is a statistics and data science researcher with experience in applied predictive modeling, public health analytics, and decision-making with real-world data. She is passionate about mathematics and enjoys analyzing meaningful problems, especially those related to community well-being.
DOWNLOAD Resume
When she is not studying or building statistical models, Azadeh loves tutoring mathematics, mentoring students, and spending time with her family.

title: Azadeh Baniasad
text:

University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA)
B.A. in Statistics & Data Science (in progress)
Mathematics Minor

NIH-funded ISI-BUDS Summer Institute in Biostatistics & Data Science – UC Irvine

UCLA Crankstart Re-Entry Scholar

UCLA Honors Student

title: Azadeh Baniasad
text:

title: Azadeh Baniasad
text:
Research Experience

UCLA Department of Statistics – Stats 199 Research
Mentor: Prof. Rob Gould
Fall 2025 – Present

Analyzing California TB data (2015–2023) to study relationships between wildfire smoke exposure, environmental PM2.5, and TB treatment outcomes

Completed UCLA CITI Human Subjects Research training and IRB preparation

Building reproducible workflows using R, Quarto, and GitHub



UC Irvine – ISI-BUDS HIV/TB Project
Summer 2025

Built logistic regression and baysian models to examine HIV status, ART history, CD4 count, and TB treatment outcome in Botswana

Worked directly with REDCap datasets and epidemiology researchers

Presented findings to ISI-BUDS faculty and research teams

title: Azadeh Baniasad
text:
Technical Skills

Programming: R (tidyverse, mlr3, glmnet, ggplot2, sf, mapview), MATLAB, python
Modeling: Logistic regression, regression trees, splines, model selection (AIC/BIC), VIF analysis, PCA

Data Workflows: Reproducible research with Quarto and LaTeX

Specialty Data: Environmental PM2.5, wildfire smoke exposure, public health surveillance datasets

title: Azadeh Baniasad
text:
Teaching & Service

Math Tutor Mathematics tutor at Pierce College and community education programs

Mento Mentor for high school and community college students in Math and Stats
